description: Numerators of sequence {b(1), b(2), ...} which when COMPOSED with itself gives {1,2,3,...}.
links: Dmitry Kruchinin, Vladimir Kruchinin, Method for solving an iterative functional equation $A^{2^n}(x)=F(x)$ , arXiv:1302.1986
formula: a(n)=numerator(T(n,1)), T(n,m)=1/2*(binomial(n+m-1,2*m-1)-sum(i=m+1..n-1, T(n,i)*T(i,m))), n>m, T(n,n)=1.  [From Vladimir Kruchinin, Mar 14 2012]
mathematica: t[n_, m_] := t[n, m] = If[ n == m , 1 , 1/2*(Binomial[n+m-1, 2*m-1] - Sum[t[n, i]*t[i, m], {i, m+1, n-1}])]; a[n_] := t[n, 1] // Numerator; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 28}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Feb 26 2013, after _Vladimir Kruchinin_ *)
prog: (Maxima)T(n, m):=if n=m then 1 else 1/2*(binomial(n+m-1, 2*m-1)-sum(T(n, i)*T(i, m), i, m+1, n-1));makelist(num(T(n, 1)), n, 1, 10); [From Vladimir Kruchinin, Mar 14 2012]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
